Refer the NHAI/Policy guidelines No. 7.1.54/2019 dated April 2019 on the above subject. 2_ Authority in its 138th meeting decided a two stage approval appraisal process for the projects. In the first   stage, the feasibility and the   probable alignment would be worked out and funds approved for the pre-construction activities based on the detailed analysis of cost of land acquisition and other pre- construction activities. In the second stage, the full project and the mode of the execution would be approved. 3_ Accordingly, para 4 of the above referred policy circular has been amended as under: EC discussed the above matters and asked each Member to furnish to Finance Division a list of high priority projects balance for award under their jurisdiction alongwith the budget for pre-construction activities including LA for each project: The projects in the list shall be appraised approved in two stages. In the first stage, the project feasibility and the most feasible alignment would be finalized alongwith the project features and funds would be approved for the pre-construction activities based on the detailed analysis of cost of land acquisition and other pre-construction activities by the committee competent for appraising the project: In the second stage, the full project and the mode of the execution would be appraised & approved. 4 In addition to the above, the 3A notification would be published only after first stage appraisal of the project is complete.
